detail.content: Choreography: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Choreography  OART-UT.805 Studio 2 Credits Instructor(s): Check Albert The purpose of this studio course is to enable the student to gain an appreciation and knowledge of dance creation through movement exploration and performance. We focus on the foundations of choreography through better understanding use of space, control, aesthetics, alignment, musicality, development of learning strategies within a duet/group context, as well as personal and artistic expression. Each student will make solos, duets, and collaborative group work as well as present their work to an audience at the end of the semester.  Check Albert for course schedule. Choreographers, Composers, and Designers Collaboration: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                               Skip to content        About Tisch Leadership Team A Brief History Tisch and the Community Faculty Interdisciplinary Collaborations The NYU and Tisch Campus New York City Life Getting Here  home > About Tisch        Choreographers, Composers, and Designers - Dance / Musical Theater Writing / Design for Stage and Film   << Loading... >>  *Please Note: You are using an older browser or a browser that doesn't support the styles and javascript used in this page. This browser will not display the photo gallery correctly.             Choreographers’, Composers’ and Designers’ Workshop, is a collaborative performance project of Tisch Dance, utilizing design teams (lighting, costumes, and sets) drawn from the Graduate Department of Design for Stage and Film and composers drawn from the Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program, who work with the choreographers to produce dance/theater works which are then fully produced and performed. Each choreographic project has a text source, although its ultimate use within the work can vary greatly. The choreographers meet on a weekly basis with the designers and composers to discuss and decide on set, costume, lighting and musical choices and the design and composing teams also attend rehearsals to continue the collaborative process. The class has a choreographing mentor who attends weekly rehearsals, as well as design and composing mentors. The pieces are presented in a rather elaborate concert with live music at the end of the semester.    Please see the formal course description and full photo credits below.    H14.1012-1013 (Undergraduate) & H14.2040-2041 (Graduate) Directing/Choreographing Workshop    Choreographers work on individual and collaborative projects that explore the relationship between text and movement. Creative projects, in collaboration with the Department of Design for Stage and Film and the Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program, are performed in concert at the conclusion of the course.    With Flying Colors Choreographed by: Faye Minli Lim & Christeen Stridsberg Text Source: “Test” by G.A. Ingersoll Sound Composed by: Eric Kubo & Zach Redler Set Design: Brett J. Banakis Lighting Design: Nick Solyom Costume Design: Carisa Bush Performers: Hollis Bartlett, Alisa Fendley, Julie McMillan, Penda N’diaye, Gary Schaufeld & James Sargent as the Proctor    “We are momentarily delayed…” Choreographed by: Hee Ra Yoo & Lara Gemmiti in collaboration with the dancers Sound Composed by: Clive Chang, Zac Kline & Sebastian Fabal Set Design: Pilyoung Oh Lighting Design: Nick Kolin Costume Design: Brenda Abbandandolo Performers: Tracy Gilland, Tzu-Ying Lee, Kao Vey Saephanh, Stephanie Sherman & Saeed Siamak    OUT of print Choreographed by: Elizabeth Beres & Laurel Snyder in collaboration with the dancers Sound Composed by: Mark Evans, Kat Harris & Matteo Martis Set Design: Carmen Cardenas Lighting Design: Mike Inwood Costume Design: Carolyn Hoffmann Performers: Faye Minli Lim, Perin Hailey McNelis & Dana Thomas    One Who Lies in Wait Choreographed by: Nicholas Strafaccia & Regina Sobel in collaboration with the dancers Sound Composed by: Jonathan Russ & Hannah Kohl Set Design: Carmen Cardenas Lighting Design: Mike Inwood Costume Design: Carolyn Hoffmann Performers: Kate Ann Behrendt, Danielle McIntosh, Elizebeth Randall & Gary Schaufeld    Lullabye Choreographed by: Sam Wentz & Saeed Siamak Text Source: “Love You Forever” by Robert Munsch Sound Composed by: Jaime Lozano Set Design: Brett J. Banakis Lighting Design: Nick Solyom Costume Design: Carisa Bush Performers: Catherine De Angelis, Lara Gemmiti, Tenaya Kelleher, Elizebeth Randall & Laurel Snyder       Wisconsin Death Trip Choreographed by: Elliott Reiland & Ramona Kelley Text Source: Adapted from the compilation by Michael Lesy Sound Composed by: Gena Oppenheim & Robert Edridge-Waks Set Design: David Meyer Lighting Design: Amanda Clegg Lyon Costume Design: Haley Lieberman Performers: Jesse Beck, Angela Curotto, Benjamin Kimitch, Ashley Lynn Marinelli, Megan Roup & Jaclyn K.
